sen.j: 福知山線（ふくちやません）は、兵庫県尼崎市の尼崎駅 (JR西日本)から京都府福知山市の福知山駅に至る西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の鉄道路線（幹線）である。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Line is a railway (trunk line) of West Japan Railway Company that connects Amagasaki Station in Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture, with Fukuchiyama Station in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

The Fukuchiyama Line is a railway (trunk line) of the West Japan Railway Company that connects Amagasaki Station in Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture, with Fukuchiyama Station in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

The Fukuchiyama Line is a (trunk) railway line operated by the West Japan Railway Company that connects Amagasaki Station in Amagasaki City, Hyogo Prefecture, and Fukuchiyama Station in Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 東海道本線の大阪～尼崎間を含む大阪～篠山口間にJR宝塚線（ジェイアールたからづかせん）の愛称がある。
sen.e: The line between Osaka Station and Sasayamaguchi Station on Tokaido Main Line, including the line between Osaka Station and Amagasaki Station, is fondly referred to as "JR Takarazuka Line."

The line between Osaka Station and Sasayamaguchi Station on the Tokaido Main Line, including the section between Osaka Station and Amagasaki Station, is fondly referred to as the "JR Takarazuka Line."

The line that runs between Osaka Station and Sasayamaguchi Station on the Tokaido Main Line, which includes the line between Osaka Station and Amagasaki Station, is fondly referred to as the JR Takarazuka Line.
sen.cmt: レビュー結果の翻訳に変更しました。

sen.j: 阪急電鉄にも阪急宝塚本線があるため、混同を避けるために愛称に「JR」と付けている。
sen.e: Since Hankyu Corporation owns the Hankyu Takarazuka Line, "JR" is added to the nickname so as to avoid confusion.
Because the Hankyu Corporation owns the Hankyu Takarazuka Line, "JR" is added to the nickname in order to avoid confusion.

sen.cmt: レビュー結果の翻訳に変更しました。

sen.j: また尼崎～谷川間が大都市近郊区間に含まれ、JR宝塚線の区間はアーバンネットワークの路線の一つとなっている。
sen.e: As the line between Amagasaki Station and Tanikawa Station is included in the urban neighborhood, the block on the JR Takarazuka Line is one of the Urban Network lines.

sen.j: 塚口・尼崎間で東海道本線に合流し大阪駅に至る。
sen.e: The Fukuchiyama Line merges into the Tokaido Main Line at a point between Tsukaguchi Station and Amagasaki Station, and reaches Osaka Station.
The Fukuchiyama Line merges into the Tokaido Main Line at a point between Tsukaguchi Station and Amagasaki Station, and then reaches Osaka Station.

sen.j: JR宝塚線としての日本の鉄道ラインカラー一覧は黄色（■）であり、選定理由は「これからの新しい開発エリアを示すイキイキとしたイメージ」とされている。
sen.e: The line's own color of JR Takarazuka Line is yellow, which is said to be chosen as 'a vivid image representing new developable areas for the future.'

sen.j: 大阪と北近畿を結ぶ路線であると同時に、兵庫県東部の各都市から大阪への通勤・通学路線となっている。
sen.e: The Fukuchiyama Line is not only a line that connects Osaka with northern Kinki but is a commuter line for office workers and students who commute from each city in eastern Hyogo to Osaka.
sen.cmt: この「大阪」は、「府」とも「市」とも判断できない表記なので、「Osaka」と致しました。

sen.j: また、大阪と山陰地方を結ぶルートの一つである。
sen.e: It is also one of the lines connecting Osaka and the Sanin region.

sen.e: * The section between Amagasaki Station and Shinsanda Station is under the direct control of West Japan Railway Company, Osaka Branch Office while that between Shinsanda Station and Fukuchiyama Station, except stations at both ends of this interval, is under the control of West Japan Railway Company, Fukuchiyama Branch Office, Sasayamaguchi Railways Department (Fukuchiyama Station is under the direct control of the Fukuchiyama Branch Office).

* The section between Amagasaki Station and Shin-Sanda Station is under the direct control of the West Japan Railway Company's Osaka Branch Office, while that between Shin-Sanda Station and Fukuchiyama Station (except for the stations at both ends of this interval) is under the control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama Branch Office, Sasayamaguchi Railways Department (Fukuchiyama Station is under the direct control of the Fukuchiyama Branch Office).

* The section between Amagasaki Station and Shin-Sanda Station is under the direct control of the West Japan Railway Company's Osaka Branch Office, while that between Shin-Sanda Station and Fukuchiyama Station (except for the stations at both ends of this interval) is under the control of West Japan Railway Company's Fukuchiyama Branch Office, Sasayamaguchi Railways Department (Fukuchiyama Station is under the direct control of the Fukuchiyama Branch Office).

sen.j: 1986年まで客車普通列車が走っていたり、生瀬～道場付近では武庫川の渓流の眺めを楽しめたりするなど、のどかなローカル路線の体であったが、同年の宝塚～新三田間の複線電化を機にそれらは姿を消し、沿線住宅開発の進展とJR東西線の開業などにより新型電車が行き交う通勤路線となっている。
sen.e: Up to 1986, the Fukuchiyama Line was a tranquil local line where passenger local trains were running and scenery of a Muko-gawa River stream was enjoyed near Namaze and Dojo; however, these scenes disappeared as the line between Takarazuka Station and Shinsanda Station was double-tracked and electrified in 1986, and it was transformed into a commuter line on which new type of trains run with the promotion of housing development along the line and the establishment of the JR Tozai Line.

Up to 1986, the Fukuchiyama Line was a tranquil local line where passenger local trains ran and the scenery of a Muko-gawa River stream was enjoyed near Namaze and Dojo; however, these scenes disappeared as the line between Takarazuka Station and Shin-Sanda Station was double-tracked and electrified in 1986, and it was transformed into a commuter line on which new types of trains run, housing development is promoted along the line and the JR Tozai Line has been established.

Up to 1986, the Fukuchiyama Line was a tranquil local line where passenger local trains ran and the scenery of a Muko-gawa River stream was enjoyed near Namaze and Dojo; however, these scenes disappeared as the line between Takarazuka Station and Shin-Sanda Station was double-tracked and electrified in 1986, and it was transformed into a commuter line on which new types of trains run, housing development is promoted along the line and the JR Tozai Line has been established.

sen.j: 宝塚以北の武庫川渓流沿いの旧線は廃線となったが（一部は遊歩道となっている）、それでもこの線は川との関係が深い。
sen.e: Although the old railway to the north of Takarazuka along Muko-gawa River was discontinued (a part of the line is now used as a walking trail), the Fukuchiyama Line and Muko-gawa River still have close ties with each other.

Although the old railway to the north of Takarazuka along the Muko-gawa River was discontinued (a part of the line is now used as a walking trail), the Fukuchiyama Line and Muko-gawa River still have close mutual ties.

Although the old railway to the north of Takarazuka along the Muko-gawa River was discontinued (a part of the line is now used as a walking trail), the Fukuchiyama Line and Muko-gawa River still have close mutual ties.

sen.j: 宝塚駅から古市駅までは武庫川と何度も交差しながら遡り、篠山口駅から谷川駅は加古川支流の篠山川の渓流沿いに下る。
sen.e: The railway lies upward along and crosses Muko-gawa River at many locations between Takarazuka Station and Furuichi Station, and stretches downward along Sasayama-gawa River which is a stream of Kako-gawa River between Sasayamaguchi Station and Tanigawa Station.

The railway lies upward along and crosses THE Muko-gawa River at many points between Takarazuka Station and Furuichi Station, and it stretches downward along the Sasayama-gawa River, which is a stream of Kako-gawa River between Sasayamaguchi Station and Tanigawa Station.

The railway lies upward along and crosses the Muko-gawa River at many points between Takarazuka Station and Furuichi Station, and it stretches downward along the Sasayama-gawa River, which is a stream of Kako-gawa River between Sasayamaguchi Station and Tanikawa Station.
sen.cmt: THE →the としました。Tanikawa としました。

sen.j: 福知山線の最大の特徴はトンネル無しに分水界を越えること。
sen.e: The greatest characteristic of the Fukuchiyama Line is that it crosses the watershed with no tunnels.
The greatest characteristic of the Fukuchiyama Line is that it crosses the watershed with no tunnels.
The greatest characteristic of the Fukuchiyama Line is that it crosses the watershed with no tunnels.

sen.j: 石生駅周辺は太平洋と日本海を分ける分水嶺の高度が本州で最も低い所（この辺りでは分水田圃）であり、田圃の中を走っているうちにいつの間にか日本海へ注ぐ由良川沿いの福知山駅に到着する。
sen.e: The area around Iso Station has the lowest point of watershed in Honshu (rice fields around this area are watershed rice fields) and the railway reaches Fukuchiyama Station on Yura-gawa River that flows into the Sea of Japan, without even noticing while a train is running in the scenery of rice fields.

The area around Iso Station has the lowest point of watershed in Honshu (the fields around this area are watershed rice fields) and the railway reaches Fukuchiyama Station on the Yura-gawa River, which flows into the Sea of Japan, seemingly oblivious to the fact that a train is running amid the scenery of rice fields.

The area around Iso Station has the lowest point of watershed in Honshu which devides Pacific Ocean and the Sea of Japan (the fields around this area are watershed rice fields) and the railway reaches Fukuchiyama Station on the Yura-gawa River, which flows into the Sea of Japan, seemingly oblivious to the fact that a train is running amid the scenery of rice fields.
sen.cmt: 太平洋と日本海を分ける を追加しました。

sen.j: 福知山駅の手前では、再建された福知山城天守閣が見える。
sen.e: The tower of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle, which has been reconstructed, can be seen from a train window before Fukuchiyama Station.
The tower of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle, which has been reconstructed, can be seen from a train window before reaching Fukuchiyama Station.
The tower of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle, which has been reconstructed, can be seen from a train window before reaching Fukuchiyama Station.

sen.j: 川西池田駅から西宮名塩駅間、三田駅から丹波大山駅間、柏原駅から福知山駅間は国道176号とほぼ並行している。
sen.e: The sections between Kawanishiikeda Station and Nishinomiyanajio Station, between Sanda Station and Tamba-Oyama Station, and between Kaibara Station and Fukuchiyama Station are running nearly in parallel with the National Highway 176.

sen.j: 福知山線は尼崎駅が起点だが、すべての列車が尼崎駅を介して大阪駅（一部はさらにその先のJR京都線）に、もしくはJR東西線を経由し片町線に乗り入れている。
sen.e: The starting point of the Fukuchiyama Line is Amagasaki Station, but all trains get to Osaka Station (some of them even go up to the JR Kyoto Line beyond Osaka Station) via Amagasaki Station or go into the Katamachi Line through the JR Tozai Line.

The starting point of the Fukuchiyama Line is Amagasaki Station, but all trains reach Osaka Station (some of them even go up to the JR Kyoto Line beyond Osaka Station) via Amagasaki Station or go into the Katamachi Line via the JR Tozai Line.

sen.j: 福知山駅からは特急列車が山陰本線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道に直通している。
sen.e: Some Limited Express trains directly run into the track of Kitakinki Tango Railway on the Sanin Main Line from Fukuchiyama Station.

Some limited express trains run directly into the track of Sanin Main Line or Kitakinki Tango Railway from Fukuchiyama Station.

sen.j: 北近畿ビッグXネットワークの一角（「X」の左斜め下の部分が福知山線）としての機能があり、以下の列車が福知山線全線を通して運転され、さらに北近畿タンゴ鉄道・宮津駅方面、山陰本線・豊岡駅 (兵庫県)・城崎温泉駅（下り）方面まで運転されている。
sen.e: The higher category trains function as a part of the North Kinki Big X Network (the left oblique downward part of X represents the Fukuchiyama Line) and the following trains run not only throughout the Fukuchiyama Line but for Miyazu Station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway and Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) or Kinosakionsen Station (down line) on the Sanin Main.

The higher category trains function as part of the North Kinki Big X Network (the left oblique downward part of "X" represents the Fukuchiyama Line), and the following trains run not only throughout the Fukuchiyama Line but also for Miyazu Station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway and Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) or Kinosakionsen Station (down line) on the Sanin Main Line.

The Fukuchiyama Line functions as part of the North Kinki Big X Network (the left oblique downward part of "X" represents the Fukuchiyama Line), and the following higher category trains run not only throughout the Fukuchiyama Line but also for Miyazu Station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway and Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) or Kinosakionsen Station (outbound line) on the Sanin Main Line.

sen.j: 福知山線は大阪と北近畿を福知山駅経由で「南北」に結ぶ鉄道である。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Line is a railway that connects Osaka with northern Kinki through Fukuchiyama Station north and south.

sen.j: 従来、福知山線は単線の地方ローカル線として運行されていた。
sen.e: The Fukuchiyama Line used to be operated as a single-track local line.
The Fukuchiyama Line used to be operated as a single-track local line.
The Fukuchiyama Line used to be operated as a single-track local line.

sen.j: 乗車人員が少ない駅が多かったが、1986年11月1日の宝塚以北電化、宝塚～新三田間複線化を機に、篠山口駅以南では沿線の開発が急ピッチで進められ、その上並行する阪急電鉄阪急宝塚本線・阪急伊丹線から大幅に乗客がシフトしたこともあって乗客数は急増。
sen.e: There used to be many stations used by a small number of passengers; however, the number of passengers increased enormously not only because the development along the line below Sasayamaguchi Station moved ahead at a fast pace as the line above Takarazuka was electrified and the line between Takarazuka and Shinsanda was doubly tracked on November 1, 1986, but also because many passengers switched from the Hankyu Takarazuka Line of Hankyu Railway and the Hankyu Itami Line, which lie in parallel with the Fukuchiyama Line, to the Fukuchiyama Line.

There used to be many stations used by small numbers of passengers, but the numbers of passengers increased enormously, not only because the development along the line below Sasayamaguchi Station moved ahead at a fast pace as the line above Takarazuka was electrified and the line between Takarazuka and Shinsanda was double-tracked on November 1, 1986, but also because many passengers switched from the Hankyu Takarazuka Line of the Hankyu Railway and the Hankyu Itami Line (which lie in parallel with the Fukuchiyama Line) to the Fukuchiyama Line.

There used to be many stations used by small numbers of passengers, but the numbers of passengers increased enormously, not only because the development along the line below Sasayamaguchi Station moved ahead at a fast pace as the line above Takarazuka was electrified and the line between Takarazuka and Shin-Sanda was double-tracked on November 1, 1986, but also because many passengers switched from the Hankyu Takarazuka Line of the Hankyu Railway and the Hankyu Itami Line (which lie in parallel with the Fukuchiyama Line) to the Fukuchiyama Line.

sen.j: JR発足時は、1日の運転本数が100本足らずだった福知山線は、1997年のJR東西線開業以降は1日360本を超える過密ダイヤ（近隣の同じ複線路線である阪和線や大和路線に比べれば本数はまだ少ないが、これがJR福知山線脱線事故の一因になったともいわれる）へと変化していった。
sen.e: The Fukuchiyama Line, which used to have less than 100 trains operated a day at the time of the inauguration of JR, started changing to a line with a tight railroad schedule (, which is still less tight than the schedule of the Hanwa Line and the Yamatoji Line, but it is said that this tight schedule contributed to the JR Fukuchiyama Line Train Derailment Accident) having over 360 trains a day after the inauguration of JR Tozai Line in 1997.

The Fukuchiyama Line, which had fewer than 100 trains operated a day at the time of the inauguration of JR, started changing to a line with a tight railroad schedule (which is still less tight than the schedule of the Hanwa Line or the Yamatoji Line, but it is said that this tight schedule contributed to the JR Fukuchiyama Line Train Derailment Accident) had over 360 trains a day after the inauguration of the JR Tozai Line in 1997.

The Fukuchiyama Line, which had fewer than 100 trains operated a day at the time of the inauguration of JR, started changing to a line with a tight railroad schedule and had over 360 trains a day after the inauguration of the JR Tozai Line in 1997 (which is still less tight than the schedule of the Hanwa Line or the Yamatoji Line that are double-tracked in the same way as the Fukuchiyama Line, but it is said that this tight schedule contributed to the JR Fukuchiyama Line Train Derailment Accident).
sen.cmt: 括弧を文末に移動しました。複線路線 を追加しました。

sen.j: 篠山口駅以南の複線化による増発で大阪駅へのアクセスが飛躍的に向上し、JR東西線の開業で大阪市内や大阪東部、奈良方面とのアクセスも充実した。
sen.e: Along with the double tracked line below Sasayamaguchi Station, the number of trains has increased and the access to Osaka Station has improved dramatically, and at the same time, the inauguration of JR Tozai Line has provided good accessibility to Osaka City, eastern Osaka, and the direction of Nara.

Along with the double-tracked line below Sasayamaguchi Station, the number of trains has increased and access to Osaka Station has improved dramatically; moreover, the inauguration of the JR Tozai Line has provided good accessibility to Osaka City, eastern Osaka and the direction of Nara.

Along with the double-tracked line below Sasayamaguchi Station, the number of trains has increased and access to Osaka Station has improved dramatically; moreover, the inauguration of the JR Tozai Line has provided good accessibility to Osaka City, eastern Osaka and the direction of Nara.

sen.j: 福知山線で最も利用者の多い駅は宝塚駅で、2004年度現在 での1日の乗車客数約3万人。
sen.e: The busiest railway station in the Fukuchiyama Line is Takarazuka Station which is used, as of 2004, by about 30,000 people a day.

sen.j: 大阪～篠山口間と篠山口～福知山間では乗客数に大きな差があるため、一部の全線直通運転の快速列車は篠山口駅で増解結が行われ、大阪～篠山口間では8両、篠山口～福知山間では4両で運転される。

sen.e: The Fukuchiyama Line features expensive fare for a JR line around Osaka because the line, including the section between Amagasaki and Takarazuka, was not included in the Osaka Train Specific Section in the JNR years.

sen.j: 福知山線の発祥は、川辺馬車鉄道が開業させた尼ヶ崎（のちの尼崎港）～伊丹間の馬車鉄道である。
sen.e: Fukuchiyama Line was originally started as a horse tramway that was established by Kawabe [Kawanobe] Basha Tetsudo and was connecting Amagasaki (later Amagasaki-ko) and Itami.
sen.cmt: 「Amagasaki-ko」は駅名ですので、このような表記と致しました。（「Port of Amagasaki」とはしませんでした。）

sen.j: のちに摂津鉄道と改称して馬車鉄道を蒸気動力の軽便鉄道に改築し尼ヶ崎～池田（現在の川西池田）間を開業させた。
sen.e: Kawabe [Kawanobe] Basha Tetsudo later changed its name to Settsu Railway, reconstructed the horse tramway into a light railway using a steam power, and started their services between Amagasaki and Ikeda (current Kawanishiikeda).

sen.j: 当時の池田駅は呉服橋西詰付近にあった。

sen.j: 摂津鉄道は、大阪市から舞鶴市までの鉄道を計画していた阪鶴鉄道に合併され、改軌した上で宝塚駅まで開業。
sen.e: Settsu Railway merged with Hankaku Railway, which was planning to build a railway from Osaka City to Maizuru City then, and corrected its track gauge to expand their services up to Takarazuka Station.

sen.j: 以後順次延伸されて、1899年には福知山南口駅（堀内田町付近）まで開通した。
sen.e: After that, their services were gradually expanded and opened to traffic up to Fukuchiyama-Minamiguchi Station (near Horiuchida-cho) in 1899.

sen.j: 1904年、軍部からの要請で対ロシア戦略の軍用鉄道として舞鶴鎮守府までの開通を急がされた福知山～綾部～新舞鶴（現在の東舞鶴駅）間が官設で開通。
sen.e: In 1904, the section between Fukuchiyama and Shinmaizuru (current Higashi-Maizuru Station) by way of Ayabe, which was rushed to open to traffic up to the Maizuru army base by the military as a military railway for the strategy against Russia, was opened to traffic under the control of the government.

In 1904, the section between Fukuchiyama and Shinmaizuru (currently Higashi-Maizuru Station) by way of Ayabe--which was rushed by the military in order to open to traffic up to the Maizuru army base as a military railway for the strategy against Russia--was opened to traffic under the control of the government.

In 1904, the section between Fukuchiyama and Shin-Maizuru (currently Higashi-Maizuru Station) by way of Ayabe--which was rushed by the military in order to open to traffic up to the Maizuru army base as a military railway for the strategy against Russia--was opened to traffic under the control of the government.

sen.j: 阪鶴鉄道も現在の福知山駅（天田）まで延伸し、福知山～新舞鶴間の貸与を受けて、大阪～舞鶴間を結ぶ鉄道が完成した。
sen.e: Hankaku Railway also expanded their services up to current Fukuchiyama Station (Amata) and completed the railway line between Osaka and Maizuru by lending the section between Fukuchiyama and Shinmaizuru.
sen.cmt: 「福知山～新舞鶴間の貸与を受けて」という部分は、「政府からの貸与を受けて」という意味だと思いますが、定かではないので、訳文には「政府から」というニュアンスは反映いたしませんでした。
sen.e: Hankaku Railway also expanded its services up to the present-day Fukuchiyama Station (Amata), and completed the railway line between Osaka and Maizuru by lending the section between Fukuchiyama and Shinmaizuru.

Hankaku Railway also expanded its services up to the present-day Fukuchiyama Station (Amata), and completed the railway line between Osaka and Maizuru by lending the section between Fukuchiyama and Shin-Maizuru.

sen.j: 阪鶴鉄道は1907年に国有化され、官設区間とあわせて阪鶴線と呼ばれていたが、山陰本線の京都～出雲今市（現在の出雲市）間が1912年に開通したのを機に、神崎（現在の尼崎）～福知山間、塚口～尼ヶ崎間が福知山線となった。
sen.e: Hankaku Railway was nationalized in 1907 and its railway line, including the part under the control of the government, was called Hankaku Line; however, as the section on the Sanin Main Line between Kyoto and Izumoimaichi (current Izumo City) was opened to traffic in 1912, the sections between Kanzaki (current Amagasaki) and Fukuchiyama and between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki became Fukuchiyama Line.

Hankaku Railway was nationalized in 1907 and its railway line, including the portion under government control, was called the Hankaku Line; however, as the section on the Sanin Main Line between Kyoto and Izumoimaichi (currently Izumo City) was opened to traffic in 1912, the sections between Kanzaki (currently Amagasaki) and Fukuchiyama and between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki became known as the Fukuchiyama Line.

Hankaku Railway was nationalized in 1907 and its railway line, including the portion under government control, was called the Hankaku Line; however, as the section on the Sanin Main Line between Kyoto and Izumoimaichi (currently Izumo City) was opened to traffic in 1912, the sections between Kanzaki (currently Amagasaki) and Fukuchiyama and between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki became known as the Fukuchiyama Line.

sen.j: 大阪と山陰方面を結ぶ亜幹線とされたが、線路改良や電化などの近代化は大幅に遅れた。
sen.e: Although the railway line was designated as a semi main line that connects Osaka and the direction of Sanin, the modernization such as track improvement and electrification was delayed significantly.

sen.j: さらに国鉄C54形蒸気機関車や国鉄DD54形ディーゼル機関車が配属され、特急「まつかぜ (列車)」が福知山線経由で1961年から設定されていたが、1972年に新設された特急「はまかぜ (列車)」に至っては時間短縮を理由に姫路経由となるなど亜幹線として機能しているとは言い難い状況であった。
sen.e: In addition, although not only JNR Steam Locomotive C54 class and JNR Diesel Locomotive Type DD54 had been assigned but Limited Express "Matsukaze" had been operated since 1961, given that Limited Express "Hamakaze" that had been newly started in 1972 was changed to a train with a stopover in Himeji for reasons related to reduction in operating hours, it was far from functioned as a semi main line.

Moreover, although not only JNR Steam Locomotive C54 class and JNR Diesel Locomotive Type DD54 had been assigned but also the limited express "Matsukaze" had been operated since 1961, given that the limited express "Hamakaze," which had been newly started in 1972, was changed to a train with a stopover in Himeji for reasons related to the reduction in operating hours, it was far from functioning as a semi-main line.

Moreover, although not only JNR Steam Locomotive C54 class and JNR Diesel Locomotive Type DD54 had been assigned but also the Limited Express 'Matsukaze (train)' had been operated since 1961, given that the Limited Express 'Hamakaze (train),' which had been newly started in 1972, was changed to a train with a stopover in Himeji for reasons related to the reduction in operating hours, it was far from functioning as a semi-main line.

sen.j: 加えて、普通列車は永らく国鉄DD51形ディーゼル機関車牽引による旧型客車が使用され続けるなど、車両面での近代化は大きく遅れていた（ただ車両については1980年代前半に生瀬～武田尾間を走行中の普通列車から身を乗り出していた小学生が誤って転落死したこともあり、大阪発着の客車列車に関しては、1985年3月のダイヤ改正で自動扉がついた国鉄12系客車客車に置き換えられて近代化している）。
sen.e: Furthermore, the modernization of rail cars was also delayed significantly as seen in long-time use of outmoded passenger cars pulled by JNR Diesel Locomotive Type DD51 for the Local trains (However, with an accident in which an elementary school student who was leaning out of the window accidentally tumbled off the moving train operated between Namaze and Takedao and died in the early 1980s, passenger cars that started from and terminated at Osaka Station were replaced with JNR Passenger Car Series 12 having automatic doors when the timetable was revised in March 1985).

Furthermore, the modernization of rail cars was also delayed significantly, as seen in the long-time use of outmoded passenger cars pulled by JNR Diesel Locomotive Type DD51 for the local trains (however, with a fatal accident in the early 1980s, in which an elementary school student who was leaning out of the window accidentally tumbled off the moving train between Namaze and Takedao, passenger cars that started from and terminated at Osaka Station were replaced with the JNR Passenger Car Series 12, equipped with automatic doors, when the timetable was revised in March 1985).

sen.j: 設備面では、1970年代後半から近代化が進められた。
sen.e: On the maintenance front, the modernization started to progress in the late 1970s.

sen.j: 1979～1980年にかけて塚口～宝塚間が順次複線化され、翌1981年に尼崎～宝塚間の電化が完了。
sen.e: In 1979 and 1980, the section between Tsukaguchi and Takarazuka was doubly tracked in sequence and in 1981, the section between Amagasaki and Takarazuka was completely electrified.
In 1979 and 1980, the section between Tsukaguchi and Takarazuka was double-tracked in sequence, and in 1981 the section between Amagasaki and Takarazuka was completely electrified.

sen.j: また、1980年代前半まで腕木式信号機が現存したが列車集中制御装置化により姿を消した。
sen.e: Some mechanical semaphore signals were seen up to the early 1980's but disappeared because of the adoption of the Centralized Train Control system.
Some mechanical semaphore signals were seen up to the early 1980s but disappeared because of the adoption of the Centralized Train Control system.

sen.j: だが、近代化後も利用客はほとんど伸びず、宝塚まで電化と同時に国鉄103系電車6両編成による普通電車が大阪～宝塚間で運転を開始したものの、後に4両編成に減車されている。
sen.e: However, despite the consequence of the modernization, the number of users increased very little and the Local train, which had been operated with 6 cars of JNR/JR Commuter Trains Series 103 between Osaka and Takarazuka since the line up to Takarazuka was electrified, accordingly began to be operated with 4 cars later.

However, despite such modernization the number of users increased very little and the local train, which had been operated with six cars of the JNR/JR Commuter Train Series 103 between Osaka and Takarazuka since the line up to Takarazuka was electrified, subsequently shifted to four-car operation.

However, despite such modernization the number of users increased very little and the local train, which had been operated with six cars of the JNR/JR Commuter Train Series 103 between Osaka and Takarazuka since the line up to Takarazuka was electrified, subsequently shifted to four-car operation.

sen.j: 当時の普通電車は毎時1本しかなく、さらに宝塚以北は気動車か客車での運転だったので、三田から大阪へ向かう客も宝塚で阪急宝塚本線に乗り換えされるなどしていた。
sen.e: Because the Local train was available only once every hour and only diesel-powered passenger cars were available above Takarazuka at that time, passengers who wanted to go from Sanda to Osaka often needed to change trains at Takarazuka Station to the Hankyu Takarazuka Line.
sen.cmt: 「気動車か客車での運転だったので」という意味が明確に理解できませんでした。「気動車」は「ディーゼルエンジンを動力源とする鉄道車両」（[http://d.hatena.ne.jp/keyword/%B5%A4%C6%B0%BC%D6]参考）、つまり動力の話が主なのに対し、「客車」とは動力ではなく、「乗客を運ぶ車両」という意味で、「AかB」という比べ方の出来ない2つのものではないかと考えました。したがって「気動車の（牽引による）客車での運転だったので」という解釈で訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Because the local train was available only once every hour and only diesel-powered passenger cars were available above Takarazuka at that time, passengers who wanted to go from Sanda to Osaka often needed to change trains at Takarazuka Station and move to the Hankyu Takarazuka Line.

Because the local train was available only once every hour and only diesel-powered passenger cars were available above Takarazuka at that time, passengers who wanted to go from Sanda to Osaka often needed to change trains at Takarazuka Station and move to the Hankyu Takarazuka Line.

sen.j: また当時は神戸電鉄経由（当時は北神急行電鉄北神線が開業していなかったので鈴蘭台・新開地経由）での所要時間とは大きく差がなかったが、本数は福知山線の方が相当少なかった。
sen.e: Also, although the time needed to get to Osaka using the Fukuchiyama Line was about the same as that of the line using Kobe Electric Railway (through Suzurandai and Shinkaichi because Hokushinkyuko Railway Hokushin Line was not opened yet then), the number of trains available per hour on the Fukuchiyama Line was much less.

Also, although the time needed to get to Osaka using the Fukuchiyama Line was approximately the same as that of the line using the Kobe Electric Railway (through Suzurandai and Shinkaichi because Hokushinkyuko Railway Hokushin Line was not yet open), far fewer trains were available per hour on the Fukuchiyama Line.

Also, although the time needed to get to Osaka using the Fukuchiyama Line was approximately the same as that of the line using the Kobe Electric Railway (through Suzurandai and Shinkaichi because Hokushinkyuko Railway Hokushin Line was not yet open), far fewer trains were available per hour on the Fukuchiyama Line.

sen.j: 福知山線にとって劇的な変化が起こるのは、1986年に宝塚～新三田間の複線化、福知山までの全線電化（電化は山陰本線城崎温泉駅まで）が完成してからである。
sen.e: A drastic change for the Fukuchiyama Line came in 1986, when the section between Takarazuka and Shinsanda was doubly tracked and all of the sections up to Fukuchiyama was electrified (The electrification was extended to Kinosakionsen Station of the Sanin Main Line).

A drastic change for the Fukuchiyama Line came in 1986, when the section between Takarazuka and Shinsanda was double-tracked and all the sections up to Fukuchiyama were electrified (the electrification was extended to Kinosakionsen Station on the Sanin Main Line).

A drastic change for the Fukuchiyama Line came in 1986, when the section between Takarazuka and Shin-Sanda was double-tracked and all the sections up to Fukuchiyama were electrified (the electrification was extended to Kinosakionsen Station on the Sanin Main Line).

sen.j: 全線電化の少し前に、武庫川の渓谷沿いに走っていたため複線化が困難であった生瀬～道場間について、トンネルの連続する複線の新線を新規に建設して切り替えられた。
sen.e: Shortly before all of the sections were electrified, the section between Namaze and Dojo, where it was difficult to doubly track because the railway lay along the gorge of Muko-gawa River, was newly constructed as a double track railway having successive tunnels.

Shortly before all the sections were electrified, the section between Namaze and Dojo, which was difficult to double-track because the railway lay along the Muko-gawa River gorge, was newly constructed as a double-track railway having successive tunnels.

Shortly before all the sections were electrified, the section between Namaze and Dojo, which was difficult to double-track because the railway lay along the Muko-gawa River gorge, was newly constructed as a double-track railway having successive tunnels.

sen.j: 全線電化以降、電車特急「北近畿」の運転開始に加え、普通電車は国鉄113系電車2両編成を主体として日中毎時3本（1本が大阪～福知山、2本が大阪～新三田）に増発されたが、2両編成は短過ぎて多くの列車で満員となり遅延が続発、特に22時台以降から最終電車にかけては時に積み残しが出るなど苦情が相次いだ。
sen.e: After the electrification, the operation of Limited Express train "Kitakinki" started and the number of Local trains available every hour during the day increased to three mainly with 2 cars of JNR/JR Suburban Trains Series 113 (one for operation between Osaka and Fukuchiyama and two for operation between Osaka and Shinsanda); however, 2 cars were not sufficient and thus many of the Local trains were packed with too many passengers and accordingly delayed in succession, thereby resulting in many complaints about, for example, bumped passengers especially for the trains after 22:00 to the last train.

After the electrification, the operation of the limited express train "Kitakinki" started and the number of local trains available every hour during the day increased to three, mainly with two cars of the JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 113 (one for operation between Osaka and Fukuchiyama and two for operation between Osaka and Shinsanda); however, it wasn't sufficient to have two cars so many of the local trains were packed with too many passengers and experienced successive delays, thereby resulting in many complaints about, for example, bumped passengers, especially for the trains after 22:00 to the last train.

After the electrification, the operation of the Limited Express 'Kitakinki' started and the number of local trains available every hour during the day increased to three, mainly with two cars of the JNR/JR Suburban Train Series 113 (one for operation between Osaka and Fukuchiyama and two for operation between Osaka and Shin-Sanda); however, it wasn't sufficient to have two cars so many of the local trains were packed with too many passengers and experienced successive delays, thereby resulting in many complaints about, for example, bumped passengers, especially for the trains after 22:00 to the last train.

sen.j: 反面、福知山線最初の開業区間でもあった塚口～尼崎港間の通称尼崎港線が、旅客営業を1981年に廃止した後、1984年に完全に廃止された。
sen.e: On the contrary, the service for passengers was stopped in 1981 and then the line was completely abandoned in 1984 on the section between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki-ko, known as Amagasaki-ko Line, which was first opened to traffic on the Fukuchiyama Line.

On the contrary, the service for passengers was stopped in 1981 and then the line was completely abandoned in 1984 on the section between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki-ko, known as Amagasaki-ko Line, which was first opened to traffic on the Fukuchiyama Line.

sen.j: 同線は1898年に東海道本線の尼崎駅への連絡線を設けて大阪方面との直通運転を始めてからは、塚口～尼崎港間の盲腸線となっていた。
sen.e: The Amagasaki-ko Line had been a Mocho (cecum) line between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki-ko since the direct operation to the direction of Osaka was started by constructing a connecting line to Amagasaki Station on the Tokaido Main Line in 1898.
sen.cmt: 「盲腸線」に関して定訳が見つからなかったため、日本語独特の表現だと考え、定義または意味を括弧などに入れて訳文上で記した方が良いかとも考えましたが、原文と等価ではなくなるため、行いませんでした。（起点・終点のどちらかが他の鉄道路線と接続しておらず、あたかも盲腸のように見える路線(又は路線の一部)のこと。「盲腸」と言う言葉には「役に立たないのになぜか残っている」といった意味合いも込められている。そのため、「短い」「列車の運行本数が少ない(又は乗客が少ない)」ことを「盲腸線」の条件とする人もいる。）[http://d.hatena.ne.jp/keyword/%CC%D5%C4%B2%C0%FE]参考
sen.e: The Amagasaki-ko Line had been a Mocho (cecum) line between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki-ko since the direct operation in the direction of Osaka was started in 1898 by constructing a connecting line to Amagasaki Station on the Tokaido Main Line.

The Amagasaki-ko Line had been a Mocho (cecum) line between Tsukaguchi and Amagasaki-ko since the direct operation in the direction of Osaka was started in 1898 by constructing a connecting line to Amagasaki Station on the Tokaido Main Line.

sen.j: その後は車両増結で対処したが、当時人口が急増していた西宮市北部地区や三田市の住民から快速列車の設定を希望する声が相次いだため、民営化後の1989年より快速が登場（快速の区間は現在と同じく、大阪～三田間のみ）。
sen.e: Although some cars were added, many people living in the northern area in Nishinomiya City and Sanda City in which rapid increase in population was seen then requested to provide Rapid trains, and some Rapid trains came on the scene after the privatization of JNR in 1989 (The section for the Rapid train was only between Osaka and Sanda, which is the same as today).

Although some cars were added, many people living in the northern area in Nishinomiya City and Sanda City, in which a rapid increase in population was seen, asked that rapid trains be provided, and some rapid trains came on the scene after the privatization of JNR in 1989 (the section for the rapid train was only between Osaka and Sanda, which is the same as today).

sen.j: この時点で日中は特急0～1本、快速2本、普通4本の現在とほぼ変わらぬ姿となる。
sen.e: At this stage, no or one Limited Express train, two Rapid trains and four Local trains became available an hour, which is almost the same as today.
sen.cmt: ここでの本数は「毎時」という意味だと思うのですが、訳文には反映した方が良いと考え、反映いたしました。
sen.e: At this stage, no or only one limited express train, two rapid trains and four local trains became available on an hourly basis, which is almost the same as today.

sen.j: この事故は、JR西日本の経営体質や社員の管理にまで言及されることとなった。

sen.j: 馬車鉄道時代は東海道線と平面交差していたが、改築後は貨車を除いて横断を禁止され、南北に構内を分断された長洲駅を旅客は徒歩連絡、貨車は人力で横断させていた。
sen.e: Although it was crossing at grade with the Tokaido Line in the horse tramway era, after the track gauge was corrected, crossing became prohibited except freight trains, and thus passengers had to walk and freight trains had to be moved by humans to cross Nagasu Station.

tit.e: The Future of the Fukuchiyama Line

tit.j: 伊丹駅と空港のアクセス
tit.e: Access from Itami Station to the airport
Access from Itami Station to the airport
Access from Itami Station to the airport

sen.j: 現在、大阪国際空港（伊丹空港）には大阪高速鉄道が乗り入れているが、JRの路線は乗り入れていない。
sen.e: Although Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd. currently has direct connection with Osaka International Airport (Itami Airport), no JR lines have been extended to the airport.
Although Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd., currently has a direct connection with Osaka International Airport (Itami Airport), no JR line has been extended to the airport.
Although Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd., currently has a direct connection with Osaka International Airport (Itami Airport), no JR line has been extended to the airport.

sen.j: そこで伊丹空港に近いJR伊丹駅から伊丹空港までの空港アクセス路線を建設する「JR福知山線分岐線構想」と言われる構想がある。
sen.e: There is an idea called "JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan" in which an airport access railway from JR Itami Station, which is close to the Itami Airport, to the Itami Airport shall be constructed.
There is a concept called the "JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan," in which an airport access railway from JR Itami Station to the nearby Itami Airport would be constructed.
There is a concept called the 'JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan,' in which an airport access railway from JR Itami Station to the nearby Itami Airport would be constructed.

sen.j: 1990年代に入り一部筋から構想が持ち上がったが、猪名川を渡ったり滑走路を地下線で横断する必要があり大回りで建設費もかさむことから実現性の薄い構想といえる（建設主体や資金の手当てなどの現実的な案はない）。
sen.e: This idea was proposed by a part of officials; however, it can be said that the possibility is very low because users would have to cross the runway which is crossing Ina-gawa River with a subway train and the line would have to make a big detour, and thus a large amount of construction cost would be required (no realistic proposal about, for example, the construction body and financing has been made).

This idea was proposed by a group of officials, but it can be said that the possibility is very low because users would have to cross the runway (which in turn crosses over the Ina-gawa River) via a subway train and the line would have to make a big detour, and thus a huge construction expense would be required (while no realistic proposal about, for example, the construction force and financing has been made).

This idea was proposed by a group of officials in the early 1990's, but it can be said that the possibility is very low because users would have to cross the runway (which in turn crosses over the Ina-gawa River) via a subway train and the line would have to make a big detour, and thus a huge construction expense would be required (while no realistic proposal about, for example, the construction force and financing has been made).
sen.cmt: 1990代に入り を追加しました。

sen.j: しかも莫大な建設費の償還が必要な大阪モノレールを窮地に追い込むことからこの構想に異を唱える意見もある。
sen.e: Furthermore, there are some people who express disagreement with this idea because it could drive Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd., which need the reimbursement of the huge construction cost, into a corner if this plan turns to reality.
Moreover, some have expressed disagreement with this idea because it could drive Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd., into a corner and it would need to have the construction cost reimbursed.
Moreover, some have expressed disagreement with this idea because it could drive Osaka Monorail Co., Ltd., into a corner, which still needs to have its huge construction cost reimbursed.
sen.cmt: 文末に一部翻訳者さんの訳を組み込み、原文の意味に近くしました。

sen.j: 現在は阪急が蛍池駅に快速急行（急行）を停車させ大阪モノレールとの連携を強化し、都心への所要時間を短縮したことにより本構想は代替されたともいえる。
sen.e: As Hankyu Railway provides Rapid Express (Express) trains that connects to Osaka Monorail at Hotarugaike Station to enhance the access, the time required to get to the city center has been reduced, and thus it may be said that "JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan" has been replaced by this route.

Because the Hankyu Railway provides Rapid Express (express) trains that connect to Osaka Monorail at Hotarugaike Station for the sake of improved access, the time required to reach the city center has been reduced, and thus it can be said that "JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan" has been replaced by this route.

Because the Hankyu Railway provides Rapid Express (express) trains that connect to Osaka Monorail at Hotarugaike Station for the sake of improved access, the time required to reach the city center has been reduced, and thus it can be said that "JR Fukuchiyama Line Branch Track Plan" has been replaced by this route.

tit.j: 篠山口駅以北の複線化と現状
tit.e: Prevalence and current situation of the double-track section above Sasayamaguchi Station
The prevalence and current situation of the double-track section above Sasayamaguchi Station
The prevalence and current situation of the double-track section above Sasayamaguchi Station

sen.j: 丹波市は、篠山口～福知山間の単線区間を複線化をJR西日本に要望している。
sen.e: Tamba City has requested West Japan Railway Company to doubly track the single-track section between Sasayamaguchi and Fukuchiyama.
Tamba City has asked West Japan Railway Company to double-track the section between Sasayamaguchi and Fukuchiyama, which is currently single-tracked.
Tamba City has asked West Japan Railway Company to double-track the section between Sasayamaguchi and Fukuchiyama, which is currently single-tracked.

sen.j: また丹波市は団体利用への運賃補助を行い、兵庫県も特急列車の料金補助を行う社会実験を実施している。
sen.e: Tamba City has been helping parties of users with their fare and Hyogo Prefecture has been implementing a pilot program in which fare for Limited Express trains is subsidized.
Tamba City has been helping users with their fares, and Hyogo Prefecture has implemented a pilot program in which fares for limited express trains were subsidized.
Tamba City has been helping users who are party travelers with their group rates, and Hyogo Prefecture has implemented a pilot program in which fares for limited express trains were subsidized.
sen.cmt: Tanba としました。団体料金の補助をしている、と解釈し、左記のようにしました。

sen.j: そして兵庫県は「乗って 近づく 複線化」、などと呼びかけている。
sen.e: Hyogo Prefecture has been declaring a slogan saying "Let's promote double tracking by the use of the Fukuchiyama Line" to the residents.
Hyogo Prefecture has promoted the slogan, "Let's encourage double-tracking through the use of the Fukuchiyama Line" among residents.
Hyogo Prefecture has promoted the slogan, 'Let's encourage double-tracking through the use of the Fukuchiyama Line' among residents.

sen.j: だが、2003年度の1日の乗車人員はこの区間の丹波大山駅から丹波竹田駅までの8駅を合わせても約3,600人であり、その多くが高校生であり、また篠山口駅以北では減少傾向にある。
sen.e: However, the ridership on this section between Tamba-Oyama Station and Tamba-Takeda Station per day in 2003, even as figures of all 8 stations on this section were added up, accounted for about 3,600 people, most of which were high school students, and furthermore, the ridership above Sasayamaguchi Station has been showing a downward trend.

However, the ridership on this section between Tamba-Oyama Station and Tamba-Takeda Station per day in 2003, even as the figures for all eight stations on the section were added up, accounted for about 3,600 people, most of whom were high-school students; and furthermore, the ridership above Sasayamaguchi Station has shown a downward trend.

However, the ridership on this section between Tamba-Oyama Station and Tamba-Takeda Station per day in the fiscal 2003, even as the figures for all eight stations on the section were added up, accounted for about 3,600 people, most of whom were high-school students; and furthermore, the ridership above Sasayamaguchi Station has shown a downward trend.

sen.j: また、尼崎駅～篠山口駅間の駅間距離が平均約2.9km（快速停車駅のみでも平均約4.1km）であるのに対し、篠山口駅～福知山駅間の駅間距離は平均約5.3kmであり、福知山線沿線に自宅を構えていても自宅から駅まで距離がある世帯が多い。
sen.e: Moreover, while the average distance between stations on the section between Amagasaki Station and Sasayamaguchi Station is about 2.9Km (the average distance between stations for Rapid trains is about 4.1Km), the figure shows about 5.3Km on the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where quite a few people live along the Fukuchiyama Line yet far from a station.

Moreover, while the average distance between stations on the section between Amagasaki Station and Sasayamaguchi Station is approximately 2.9km (the average distance between stations for rapid trains is about 4.1km), the figure indicates approximately 5.3km on the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where quite a few people live along the Fukuchiyama Line but are still far from a station.

Moreover, while the average distance between stations on the section between Amagasaki Station and Sasayamaguchi Station is approximately 2.9 km (the average distance between stations for rapid trains is about 4.1 km), the figure indicates approximately 5.3 km on the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where quite a few people live along the Fukuchiyama Line but are still far from a station.
sen.cmt: スペースを追加しました。

sen.j: その上、快速列車（丹波路快速を含む）は三田駅以北の72.8km（福知山線全営業キロの約68%）が各駅停車で利便性・速達性に乏しく、特別急行列車を利用するにしても特急料金が発生して交通費が高額になってしまう。
sen.e: In addition, the Rapid trains including trains of Tambaji Rapid Service stop every station on the 72.8-Km section above Sanda Station, which accounts for about 68% of the total operation kilometers of the Fukuchiyama Line, thereby resulting in poor convenience and promptness as well as expensive fare to take a Limited Express train.

Additionally, the rapid trains (including those of Tambaji Rapid Service) stop every station on the 72.8-km section above Sanda Station, which accounts for approximately 68% of the total operation kilometers of the Fukuchiyama Line, thereby resulting in poor convenience and promptness as well as the high fare of taking a limited express train.

Additionally, the rapid trains (including those of Tambaji Rapid Service) stop every station on the 72.8-km section above Sanda Station, which accounts for approximately 68% of the total operation kilometers of the Fukuchiyama Line, thereby resulting in poor convenience and promptness as well as the high fare of taking a limited express train.

sen.j: このため、電車よりも車でアクセスする人が多い。
sen.e: For this reason, many people living in this section use their own cars as a means of transportation instead of using a train.
Consequently, many people living in this section use their cars as a means of transportation instead of taking a train.
Consequently, many people living in this section use their cars as a means of transportation instead of taking a train.

sen.j: 山間部ということもあり、複線化は困難な状態である。
sen.e: Given the fact that the railway lies in the mountains, the situation will be difficult to doubly track this section.
Given the fact that the railway lies in the mountains, it will be difficult to double-track this section.
Given the fact that the railway lies in the mountains, it will be difficult to double-track this section.

sen.j: なお、篠山口駅から柏原駅までの間は谷川駅を経由するため遠回りをしており、さらに途中の川代渓谷は急曲線続きで速度が上がらず、たびたび崖崩れが発生し防災上も問題があることから、過去に何度か谷川駅を通らない鐘ヶ坂176号線沿いに鐘ヶ坂を越えるルートへの移設が検討されてきたが、現在の利用状況では新線の建設は困難と考えられる。
sen.e: People have often examined the idea of moving the section to the route where the train gets over Kanegasaka pass along National Highway 176 without stopping at Tanikawa Station because of the following three reasons; operating trains through Tanikawa Station in this section means an indirect path to run the train between Sasayamaguchi Station and Kaibara Station, the train cannot pick up speed due to many sharp curves along Kawashiro gorge, and this section has difficulties from the point of view of disaster prevention such as a landslide; accordingly, it seems very difficult to build a new route, given how this section has been used.

People have often examined the idea of moving the section to a route whereby the train crosses Kanegasaka pass along National Highway 176 without stopping at Tanikawa Station because of the following three reasons: operation through Tanikawa Station in this section means an indirect path to run the train between Sasayamaguchi Station and Kaibara Station, the train can't pick up speed due to many sharp curves along Kawashiro Gorge, and this section has difficulties from the perspective of disaster prevention such as in the case of a landslide; accordingly, it seems very difficult to build a new route, given the manner in which this section has been used.

People have often examined the idea of moving the section to a route whereby the train crosses Kanegasaka pass along National Route 176 without stopping at Tanikawa Station because of the following three reasons: operation through Tanikawa Station in this section means an indirect path to run the train between Sasayamaguchi Station and Kaibara Station, the train can't pick up speed due to many sharp curves along Kawashiro Gorge, and this section has difficulties from the perspective of disaster prevention such as in the case of a landslide; accordingly, it seems very difficult to build a new route, given the manner in which this section has been used.
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。

sen.j: 旧西紀町経由では丹波大山駅または下滝駅から谷川駅までが廃線になると見られることから、谷川駅に「現行ルートでの複線化」を求める横断幕があるのはこういった背景がある。
sen.e: The reason why a banner calling for "doubly tracking without changing the route" can be seen at Tanikawa Station is probably because the section between Tamba-Oyama Station or Shimotaki Station and Tanikawa Station will be dead track if the railway is moved to a route through old Nishiki-cho.
